channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dreadful pothole - getting worse, 23rd November
item.description:
When buses and heavy lorries go the whole house shakes - it’s dreadful and worry about the damage to the buildings. I can even feel the vibrations at the back of the house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brecknock Road, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Talacre Park, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bins and litter onto street, 23rd November
item.description:
This property - and the one next door (both large bed sits according to recent property sale information) - frequently has overflowing bins that mean rubbish spills out onto the street. It is unsightly and a hazard for passing pedestrians.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: W x PARKING POSTS KNOCKED OVER, 23rd November
item.description:
Opposite the church of two parking posts by the pay and display machine have been knocked over and could cause an accident.They need to be reset. First seen on friday 21.11.25

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hemsworth Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing rubbish bins and into street, 23rd November
item.description:
There are frequently overflowing bins at this house. The house number is visible in the photo. There don’t seem to be any recycling bags - just rubbish, which may be part of the problem. Unseen in this photo is the rubbish spilling onto Brownswood Dr.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sink hole opened up after heavy rain outside 38 KIVER ROAD, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti all over arches on Elephant Road, 23rd November
item.description:
I reported this last week - see attached - and it was reported as ‘fixed’. Literally nothing has been done about this. The street is an absolute disgrace! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4/5, Elephant Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Select and Save supermarket, 23rd November
item.description:
This shop is covered in graffiti, both on the shutters and above and below them. They do not care. Please use whatever against them you can to get them to fix it. They also have a cracked shop window which has been like this for ages. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Arch Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Truck with Trailer abandoned here for past 2-3 months, 23rd November
item.description:
Residents are very frustrated that this illegally parked and abandoned vehicle has been here for many months now. It is particularly annoying that it has not received any parking tickets during this time. It is difficult to understand why as parking tickets have been issued to other vehicles.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People dumping rubbish., 23rd November
item.description:
